channel.title: Educational resources and practical guides on open-archaeo
channel.description: Recent content in Educational resources and practical guides on open-archaeo

item.title: A Mobile Data-Collection Workflow for Archaeologists
item.description: A list of tools and resource for data collection and processing in the field.

item.title: a-scientific-computing-environment-for-archaeology.txt
item.description: Scientific Computing Environment for archaeology: Installing R, Rstudio and other things on a lightweight Linux in a VirtualBox virtual machine

item.title: ABC of Archaeobotanical Open Science
item.description: A list of terms related to open archaeobotanical science.

item.title: ABM tutorials
item.description: A collection of tutorial on agent-based modelling for archaeologists.

item.title: ABMA
item.description: code repository and website for Agent-Based Modeling for Archaeology.

item.title: Analysing Stable Isotope Data
item.description: Tutorial on how to visualise, analyse and interpret stable isotope data

item.title: Analysing-Archaeological-Radiocabon-Ages-Using-R
item.description: Practice some techniques for analysing archaeological radiocabon ages using R.

item.title: archaeo-db-workshop
item.description: Information and guidelines for a workshop about managing archaeological databases

item.title: archaeological-SNA-R-demo
item.description: A quick demo of archaeological social network analysis in R

item.title: AtlantGIS
item.description: Faked GIS-Datasets, simulating an island in the Atlantic for educational purposes in using GIS in archaeology

item.title: Bibliographic Database of African Scholarship on African Archaeology
item.description: An open-access database of African archaeology publications by African and Afrodescendant scholars.

item.title: Bridging the Gap ENCODE Database
item.description: Shared definitions of digital competences needed by graduate students in the programmes focusing on written cultural heritage.

item.title: caa
item.description: Statistical methods for archaeological data analysis, course website repository.

item.title: chi-field-manual
item.description: A bookdown powered manual for the small scale cultural heritage organization looking to leverage various chi techniques for their own collections.

item.title: Digital Encyclopedia of Archaeologists
item.description: A webpage containing brief biographical information about some iconic archaeologists.

item.title: DIYFieldworkDatabase
item.description: Documenting and sharing my ad-hoc fieldwork database setup

item.title: folio
item.description: Datasets for teaching quantitative approaches and modeling in archaeology and paleontology. This package provides several types of data related to broad topics (cultural evolution, radiocarbon dating, paleoenvironments, etc.), which can be used to illustrate statistical methods in the classroom (multivariate data analysis, compositional data analysis, diversity measurement, etc.).

item.title: folio
item.description: Datasets for Teaching Archaeology and Palaeontology.

item.title: GIS-Projects
item.description: GIS Projects for teaching and learning about Computational Archaeology

item.title: grass-arch
item.description: A LaTeX textbook devoted to explain how archaeologists can work with GRASS GIS

item.title: IsoDataVis
item.description: Data visualization guidelines for stable isotopes graphs, with examples

item.title: IsoMapNL
item.description: Data and script to generate a map of the Netherlands for isotopic analyses

item.title: Isotope-Visualisation
item.description: Resources relevant to visualisation of isotopic results

item.title: LA_ICP_MS-Routines_FMNH
item.description: Routines to read and analyze LA-ICP-MS data from the Field Museum’s Elemental Analysis Facility

item.title: List of Resources for getting started with (teaching) digital methods
item.description: A short list of introductory resources on DH.

item.title: marbleplan
item.description: Loading a Marble Plan fragment.

item.title: mhbil
item.description: Code repository of the book by Oliver Nakoinz and Daniel Knitter “Modelling Human Behaviour in Landscapes – Basic concepts and modelling elements”.

item.title: neiman1995
item.description: R Shiny Document - Visualizing model functions in Neimans ‘Stylistic variation in evolutionary perspective’ with an interactive document.

item.title: ODATE
item.description: An introduction to the issues, methods, and techniques of digital archaeology, integrated with working code and virtual computing environments or ’notebooks’ written in Python or R.

item.title: Open-Science-in-Phytolith-Research
item.description: Project to create community awareness of open science practices, provide training and establish a working group for open science.

item.title: photogrammetry-data-collection
item.description: Photogrammetry tutorial.

item.title: Plotting Dental Inventory with ggplot2
item.description: tutorial on an intuitive way to visualise a dental inventory in a sample

item.title: pollencount
item.description: This simulation tool aims to help students and researchers to start to see what pollen looks like under the microscope, and start to identify common pollen grains.

item.title: pred_map_tut
item.description: A tutorial for (archaeological) predictive mapping using r

item.title: R for data analysis and visualization of Archaological Data
item.description: Data Analysis and Visualization in R for Archaologists, modified from the Data Carpentry R Workshop for Ecologists.

item.title: rarcheo
item.description: Online textbook about how tackle a wide range of problems using R.

item.title: svg-pottery
item.description: A set of best practices, how-tos and implementations for publishing pottery drawings on the Web

item.title: teaching-rome
item.description: A collection of texts, 3d models, and maybe other resources useful for teaching about the Roman Empire.

item.title: tutorials
item.description: Tutorials on quantitative archaeology.

item.title: vitutr
item.description: A page for video tutorials on R, specifically for archaeology
